openIGTInterface
Class LWRStateMachineInterfaceSWIG

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      openIGTInterface.LWRStateMachineInterfaceSWIG
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class LWRStateMachineInterfaceSWIG
extends java.lang.Thread

This Class for the Communication with a control system using the opnIGTLink protocol is based on the OpenIGTLink igtutil C-Classes Wrapped using SWIG The LWRStateMachineInterface Thread is operated with a 20ms cycle. An Example of the use of this class for the communication with a State Control Software e.g. 3D Slicer see imesStateApllication. According of the data type of the OpenIGTMessage the data is packed and send to the state control. Supported data types are "STATUS", "STRING" and "TRANSFORM". Later on "POINT" will be supported.

Author:
Sebastian Tauscher
See Also:
SimpleStateExampleSWIG

Starts the listening server on the defined port.

public void stopServer()
Stops the listening OpenIGTLink server

finalize

public void finalize()
Finalize function of this class

Overrides:
finalize in class java.lang.Object

run

public void run()
main/run method of the State control Interface. In this function the server is initialized and a packet handler is started. In a loop with a cycle time of 20 ms the new Command String is received and the Acknowledgment String send back to the state control (e.g. 3D Slicer).

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

receiveMessage

public void receiveMessage()
                    throws java.io.IOException
In this function a message from the Client Socket is received and according to the OpenIGTLink datatype the recieved data is saved in the member variable CMDmessage. If the data type is neither Transform nor String an ErrorMessage is created. (Error Message not used yet...)

Throws:
java.io.IOException
